name: Rumour Detection
description: This model is based on the hierarchical transformer architecture described in the associated paper.

paper.text: Khoo, L. M. S., Chieu, H. L., Qian, Z., & Jiang, J. (2020). Interpretable rumor detection in microblogs by attending to user interactions. Proceedings of the AAAI Conference on Artificial Intelligence, April 2020 (Vol. 34, No. 05, pp. 8783-8790).

trainingDataset.text: The train and evaluation datasets were derived from the Twitter15, Twitter16 and PHEME datasets. The full dataset can be downloaded from the author's Dropbox.

evaluationDataset.text: The train and evaluation datasets were derived from the Twitter15, Twitter16 and PHEME datasets. The full dataset can be downloaded from the author's Dropbox.

evaluationScores: Retrained scores: (F1: 69.8%) | Scores reported in paper: (F1: 77.4%)
trainingTime: ~6 hours on a single V100 GPU
modelInput: Thread of tweets. The first tweet should be the target tweet.
modelOutput: Array of logits for each class (True, False, Unverified, Non-Rumour). This can be converted into probabilities using the softmax function.
usageScenarios: Rumour detection / fake news detection on Twitter
